item.title: Lydia add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lydia add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The sky above the port was the color of television, tuned to a dead channel." -- William Gibson

item.title: Lydia add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "When you want to know how things really work, study them when they're coming apart." -- William Gibson

item.title: Lydia add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The 'Net is a waste of time, and that's exactly what's right about it." -- William Gibson

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Yannick Heywang
item.description: "Being an architect isn't only about construction, it's about creating wide spaces with small spaces." -- Yannick Heywang

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "We need houses as we need clothes, architecture stimulates fashion. It’s like hunger and thirst — you need them both." -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Alain de Botton
item.description: "The architects who benefit us most maybe those generous enough to lay aside their claims to genius in order to devote themselves to assembling graceful but predominantly unoriginal boxes. Architecture should have the confidence and the kindness to be a little boring." -- Alain de Botton

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Ben Okri
item.description: "Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger." -- Ben Okri
